entry.title: Use the correct Info.plist data when validating the dynamic code signature
entry.content:
Switch to retrieving the cached Info.plist from within the browser

process and passing that to `web_app_shortcut_copier` to use for dynamic

signature validation. This ensures that validating the dynamic

signature no longer touches the app bundle on disk, side-stepping the

potential problems that pending app updates would otherwise cause.



It was incorrect to retrieve the Info.plist data via the `SecCodeRef`.

This simply reads the Info.plist from disk at the moment the data is

requested. If an app update is pending this data on disk may no longer

match the hash stored within the running application's dynamic code

signature.



Fixed: 324978880

Change-Id: I3da309e741a42e3f9a074fecc3a3f787667b4704

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5382347

Reviewed-by: Alan Cutter

entry.title: Remove //tools/perf add_option usage
entry.content:
Removes usage of add_option in //tools/perf Python code, instead using

add_argument. The following changes are necessary to call sites in

order to maintain functionality:



1. Replace %default (optparse syntax) with %(default)s (argparse syntax)

2. Pass in callables for type instead of strings



Additional cleanup is also done on touched code, such as using single

quotes instead of double quotes and removing redundant

action/default/type arguments.

entry.title: Add inspect-protocol test for 3p cookie exemption reason
entry.content:
The test creates an iframe, which calls rSA() and gets auto-granted.

It then sends a fetch request to set a cookie that is same-site

to the iframe. The cookie exemption reason should show that the cookie

is unblocked by StorageAccessAPI.

entry.title: [infra] Rename basic suites with same name as a test.
entry.content:
In order to support more flexible compositions of targets, tests

automatically define a bundle with the same name as the test. This

creates a problem for allowing legacy basic suites to be used as a

bundle within starlark because some of the basic suites share a name

with a test. This renames all such suites by appending _suite to the

name so that when support for using a basic suite as a bundle is added

there won't be any name collisions.



Bug: 1420012

Change-Id: I3a017da28ac6ba8c6b9ec15c0cf5a8e360b4cf1c

entry.title: [Extensions] Create multi service worker per extension test.
entry.content:
Creates a currently passing (but should be failing) test that simulates

the issue in the linked bug.



It does this by intercepting the

`ServiceWorkerHost::DidStopServiceWorkerContext()` mojom receiver

method. This simulates that the extension renderer service worker thread

never finished terminating and informing the //extensions browser of the

worker stopping.



It is not a perfect simulation since the worker thread does actually

stop during the test, but for the //extension browser layer purposes it

seems sufficient and non-flaky.



In order to do this testing, it required adding some testing overrides

in `ServiceWorkerTaskQueue` to allow for multiple workers to be tracked

so that we can examine them in the test without crashing.



After this change, we'll be able to validate that our upcoming fix

addresses the issue encountered in the bug.



Low-Coverage-Reason: TRIVIAL_CHANGE service_worker_task_queue.cc

contains trivial testing related changes.



Bug: 40936639

entry.title: WebUI: Migrate cr-menu-selector to CrLitElement
entry.content:
cr-menu-selector migration is trivial since this element has no UI and

no properties other than those inherited from the mixin. Consequently,

most of this CL is introducing a new CrSelectableMixin to replace

IronSelectableBehavior for Lit elements, and adding relevant tests.



Key differences between IronSelectableBehavior and CrSelectableMixin:

(1) IronSelectableBehavior supports using light DOM children for

selectable elements and also grabbed all distributed children.

CrSelectableMixin assumes the client is using a single ,

and all selectable children are in this slot's assignedElements.

This is because Lit prefers all elements to use Shadow DOM by

default.

(2) CrSelectableMixin does not support the readOnly double-bound

properties selectedItem and items. These were not used in prod

code for cr-menu-selector and Lit has no concept of readonly

properties. Instead, items and selectedItem are tracked as

private class members. A few tests accessed |items|, so a

getItemsForTest() method is provided for testing.

(3) CrSelectableMixin's iron-items-changed event does not send a

MutationRecord in the event detail.

(4) |fallbackSelection| and |activateEvent| properties and related

logic are removed since they were not used. indexOf() and

selectIndex() public methods are also removed for the same reason.

(5) forceSynchronousItemUpdate() is removed, as it was only needed in

tests, and waiting on the iron-items-updated event (or on

updateComplete, which is a similar concept already provided by

Lit itself) is sufficient.

(6) Necessary logic from other Polymer files (IronSelection and

dashToCamelCase) is folded into the mixin, rather than imported

from Polymer.



The mixin is leveraged in cr-menu-selector.



Bug: 40943652

Change-Id: I97d2ca45ab1183b1a6becf9b60bc08b13bde088a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5399520

Commit-Queue: Rebekah Potter

Reviewed-by: Demetrios Papadopoulos

entry.title: [Extensions] Improve service worker IsReadyToRunTasks() logic.
entry.content:
Incremented metrics:

Extensions.ServiceWorkerBackground.RequestedWorkerStartForStartedWorker

Extensions.ServiceWorkerBackground.AddPendingTaskForRunningWorker

Extensions.Events.DispatchToAckTime.ExtensionServiceWorker2.Inactive

Extensions.Events.DispatchToAckTime.ExtensionServiceWorker2.Active



Prior to this change ServiceWorkerTaskQueue::IsReadyToRunTasks() would

only guarantee that either DidStartWorkerForScope() or

DidStartServiceWorkerContext() had run, but both are required to run for

an extension service worker to successfully process tasks.



After this change, IsReadyToRunTasks() now additionally confirms that

both have been called before returning true. It keeps the

ServiceWorkerContext::IsLiveRunningServiceWorker() because there is an

edge case where a worker would begin stopping, but //extensions is not

yet notified of the stop yet.



Since IsReadyToRunTasks() informs multiple metrics, they all had to be

incremented as part of the change.



Low-Coverage-Reason: TRIVIAL_CHANGE service_worker_task_queue.h adds a

testing observer method that is a no-op.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=histograms logic for emitting has changed



Bug: 40909770

Change-Id: I21112430edf9b947468db39d2bfa89b95dd5753c

entry.title: [ios] Make save credit card infobar more sticky
entry.content:
This is CL is part of chain of CLs to make all the Autofill &

Password infobars on iOS a bit harder to dismiss (more sticky) to give

as much opportunity as possible to the user to save their

information upon submission of a form.



Does that by adding navigation initiated from user gesture as

a condition to dismiss the credit card infobar.



This will allow keeping the infobar when a site runs navigation

scripts after submitting a form which can dismiss the save infobar

at that moment.



Add a bit to NavigationDetails to indicate whether the navigation

was initiated by a user gesture.

entry.title: Make sure hiding a modal sheet doesn't cause it to be shown again.
entry.content:
It is possible for the completion of a modal sheet (and the following

hiding of itself and its children) to cause the parent of the modal

sheet to become the key window. If this happens, that parent would

(incorrectly) attempt to re-show the sheet that was just completed,

leading to DCHECK failures (and probably other weirdness).



With this fix, the flaky test failures from the linked bug seem to

no longer exist.



Bug: 331680186

entry.title: [A11y] Merge AXLayoutObject into AXNodeObject
entry.content:
This is the final stage of the project to remove AXLayoutObject.

This is a code simplification that will eventually allow for more

performant processing of CSS display and content-visibility toggles

in subtrees, because it will enable setting a LayoutObject in

a subtree of AXNodeObjects rather than destroying and creating a new

AXNodeObject/AXLayoutObject for every node.

entry.title: [Android TRM] Record basic metrics.
entry.content:
This CL adds the following metrics to the Tab Resumption Module:

* MagicStack.Clank.TabResumption.ClickInfo: Tile count and click index.

* MagicStack.Clank.TabResumption.ModuleNotShownReason: Reason for not

showing the TRM, if not shown.

* MagicStack.Clank.TabResumption.ModuleShowConfig: Configuration (single

or double tile, all Foreign) of the TRM, if shown.

* MagicStack.Clank.TabResumption.StabilityDelay: Duration between module

load and rendering data, if data fetch took place.



Details:

* Make HomeModulesConfigManager.getPrefModuleTypeEnabled() public.

* Add the 4 new histograms, with 3 corresponding enums of same names.

* Add new enums.xml beside magic_stack/histograms.xml.

* Add TabResumptionModuleMetricsUtils to log the above.

* Add inner class ModuleVisibility to indicate whether module is

shown, along with ModuleNotShownReason if not.

* Add computeClickInfo().

* Add record*() for the 4 new metrics.

* TabResumptionModuleUtils:

* Move decision logic in shouldShowTabResumptionModule() to

computeModuleVisibility(), which returns result as ModuleVisibility.

* For settings check, include preference checks (via

HomeModulesConfigManager.getPrefModuleTypeEnabled()).

* Update TabResumptionModuleBuilder.isEligible() to call

computeModuleVisibility() and log results if not shown.

* TabResumptionTileView.bindSuggestionClickCallback(): Add params

|tileCount| and |tileIndex|. In the |callback| closure rapper, the

(bound) params encoded into ClickInfo and logged.

* TabResumptionModuleMediator:

* ensureStabilityAndLogMetrics():

* Record ModuleStatus (depends on suggestions count)

* Add param |logStabilityDelay| to control logging StabilityDelay.

* Only record StabilityDelay on receiving STABLE suggestions.

* Add a 7 second timer to trigger ensureStabilityAndLogMetrics() to

ensure timely metrics recording.



Bug: 322898699, 1515325

There are crash reports indicating that Android CompositorImpls can

be deleted while SimpleBeginFrameObservers are still registered. Signal

OnBeginFrameSourceShuttingDown() before deleting the Compositor, as we

do in ui::Compositor.



Switch simple frame observer lists to 'ObserverList' to avoid re-entrancy

issues when notifying observers.

generated only on U but allowing the UI on lower versions is that

devices but not on the very device displaying the UI.

entry.content:
string converts to string_view implicitly, which allows string_view

operators to work with string. Fix cstring_view ctor from string to

be implicit as well, so the cstring_view operator== and operator<=>

also work with string.



Add tests for various interactions with std::string where it works

with const char* and should also work with cstring_view in the same

way (through StringViewLike template methods usually).



Also test that cstring_view works with base::StrCat({}).

entry.title: Represent Attribution interop registration events explicitly
entry.content:
Instead of a single event representing starting a request, responding,

and completing a request, a separate event represents each one. This

will make it trivial to support multiple responses per redirect chain

in the interop runner, effectively deferring support to parsing instead.



This additionally makes it possible to support, via parsing changes,

interleaved redirect chains, which are possible in production.



Bug: 330555387

entry.title: [Invokers] Reland: Only dispatch invoke for built-ins or actions containing '-'
entry.content:
(This relands

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5366502 after

fixing timeout issues in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5372478 and

new failing tests from

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5374369)



This change refactors the `HandleInvokeInternal` calls to use an enum

class of known attribute values including a `kCustom` key which can determine if the invoke action meets the criteria for being

a "custom" action - that is it includes a dash (see

https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/9841/commits/b40ba866cc21553f63d8f6244becbdbc38176310).



This also updates the tests to reflect this; only actions with a `-`, or

otherwise known actions, will dispatch an event. All other actions do

not, and must be manually dispatched. This does not preclude web authors

from manually dispatching said events.



Bug: 40947660

Change-Id: Ia704e73e50bf65b01286a148bd5b810241f0c664

entry.title: [Sync] Rename GetData() -> GetDataForCommit(), step 1
entry.content:
GetData() is only called when processor wants to commit something.

It is a valuable property, that is not expressed in the name. Some

bridges actually make use of it or would benefit from this: read only

datatypes could use NOTREACHED(), Nigori makes states validations that

are only relevant for commits.



The rename requires touching more than 90 files, not all the time in

the most straightforward name, so this CL does some groundwork:

1. Adds GetData() and GetDataForCommit() implementations to the base

bridge. This achieves multiple things:

a) Every bridge must implement at least one of those two methods (check

by NOTREACHED_NORETURN()).

b) Once there are no direct calls of GetData() (e.g. by unittests),

GetData() could be removed from the particular implementation.

c) Migrated and not migrated bridges could co-exists, allowing to split

rename into multiple CLs.

2. Apply rename to the most important usage - in the

ClientTagBasedModelTypeProcessor.

3. As an example, completes rename in HistorySyncBridge - this is also

one of the few usages, where simple rename is not enough, because same

method is used to implement GetDataForDebugging().



Bug: 331763450

Change-Id: I3f2c4c03bcf2f9857a743f864ae25632e607929b

As we will be adding another layer of code specific to iOS to the save card delegate, it makes sense to make an extension of

implementations specific to iOS to the Chrome on iOS team.



This CL is part of the chain of CLs to make the autofill and password

infobars more sticky by changing the ShouldExpire() logic of the

infobar delegates.

entry.title: Make sure the root surface has its surface ID updated when unevicted
entry.content:
The current code sets a flag to allocate a new surface ID for the ui

compositor root surface when one of its embeddees are shown. This flag

is set when an embeddee is evicted and the ui compositor is no longer

visible (and evicting the root surface is enabled). But, if a new

embeddee is created and shown, then its flag will not be set, so a new

surface ID will not be allocated for the ui compositor root surface.



This can happen if a tab is created for an evicted window, which can

happen in lacros if a link in a PWA is clicked while there is at least

one lacros window open and all lacros windows are evicted.



Bug: 330301468, 330930677

Test: CQ, local testing

Change-Id: Iad812294349ccd0df488a5dde687e1c42c0ebbac

entry.title: Allow FedCM sharing grants to resolve Storage Access requests
entry.content:
This implements an integration between FedCM and SAA (behind a flag)

which allows calls to document.requestStorageAccess to resolve

(without creating a new permission grant) if there is a corresponding

FedCM permission *and* the `kIdentityCredentialsGet` permission policy

is provided (whose default is 'self').



This CL adds the prototype and unit tests; browsertests and WPTs will

be added in followups.

entry.title: Prevent calling CountFeature() until ContainerInfoForClient is sent
entry.content:
When AssociatedRemote is used, its method must not be called before the

AssociatedReceiver is sent to a counter part. Otherwise, the mojo call

will crash. We expected DCHECK find this out, but it actually seems not

and hit by a null pointer exception in crbug.com/40918057.



This change adds an additional flag that is only updated when the

associated receiver has been sent to the renderer so that CountFeature()

won't be called before the associated receiver has been sent.



Bug: 40918057

Change-Id: Ia889caed7e2fbaab36bdcc42142236605c59c302

entry.title: Don't map oklab/oklch lightness of 0/100% to black/white
entry.content:
When this change was implemented the spec language was clear that with

any l value of 0 or 100% the values of a and b should be zero and

the resulting color will be black or white. Now it simply says that this

will happen automatically due to "gamut mapping of the display":



https://drafts.csswg.org/css-color-4/#specifying-lab-lch



Gamut mapping itself is still an arena of great debate, but in the

meantime this discontinuity is jarring to web authors and is not

implemented in other UAs. This CL rolls it back.



There are a few tests that are testing the specific behavior before the

rollback. They could be deleted, but in the meantime I'm simply adding

them to the failures.



Bug: 329106317

Change-Id: I7c908d89b4d904c1567f1a535f7b0959728855ff

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5400609

Commit-Queue: Aaron Krajeski

Reviewed-by: Philip Jägenstedt

entry.title: Reland "[AvatarButton] Fix signin paused state not clearing on signout + cleanup"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 97e5f0c6015dfc996b4281fcd593e9f908c9366c



Reason for revert: There could be a case where a StateProvider

could call for an update during the construction of all the States.

This would cause a crash since no state are currently computed or

active.



Fix in reland: Splitting the creation of the state map and the

initialization of the States (where they could potentially call

an update). Also added a layer of initialization for the

StateManager to be only created once the view (AvatarButton) is

added to the main widget to ensure that all the resources are

available.



The code changes are the same as the original CL except for the logic

mentioned above which is added (Diff with Patchset 1 for the new

changes).



Original change's description:

> [AvatarButton] Fix signin paused state not clearing on signout + cleanup

>

> Signin paused state was not active anymore, and signing out of Chrome

> did not trigger a state change. Listening to primary account change

> fixes the issue.

>

> Refactoring parts:

> - Cleaned up the StateManager code to only compute new state

> internally or by request of StateProvider implementations, to make

> sure all the states control the active state and updates properly.

> - Injected specific logic of some StateProviders from the

> AvatarToolbarButtonDelegate into the StateProvider itself, and

> give a way to retrieve the StateProvider from the StateManager

> to read the value, when that State is the button active state.

> - Removed the icon related updates from the StateManager as they

> should not alter the state.

>

> Bug: b:329802297

> Change-Id: I0728747601de816cfe477a1ad2356c1e4b6bebb3

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5380711

> Reviewed-by: David Roger

> Commit-Queue: Ryan Sultanem

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1278381}

entry.title: [viz] Have FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl unittest use TestContextProvider
entry.content:
This CL changes FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl to use TestContextProvider

to create SharedImages. The concrete motivation is that it removes

creations of ClientSharedImages with null SIIHolders, which I want to

eliminate outside of the constructors that explicitly pass the texture

target to use.



Bug: 41494843

entry.title: [UPM] Add IsUpmBackendForAccountAvailable method into utils
entry.content:
- The CL introduces the IsUpmBackendForAccountAvailable which will be

used instead of the PasswordManagerCreationCheckUtil.

isMinGmsCoreVersionAvailable() from the clank internal repo.

- The CL removes CanCreateBackend method replacing it with the newly

introduced one (the implementation of CanCreateBackend in the internal

repo call the PasswordManagerCreationCheckUtil.

isMinGmsCoreVersionAvailable).



P. S. It was discovered that because of the recently introduced build

flag, java integration tests no longer utilize the UPM flow and so don't

use the password store and password manager fakes. This issue will be

addressed in a separate CL.





Bug: 329100547

entry.title: Adds OS macros and buildflags for visionOS/watchOS.
entry.content:
Updates build_config.h to support the visionOS and watchOS

platforms. With this change, IS_IOS becomes both an individual

platform as well as a family of platforms (iOS, Mac Catalyst, watchOS,

visionOS). The child platform macros are named accordingly, for

example IS_IOS_VISION.



We considered creating a new IS_APPLEMOBILE family instead, but felt

that updating every existing use of IS_IOS would be too invasive at

this stage.



Bug: 331226142, 331320406

Change-Id: I975b48dfca70c2c02358e17c3298fa80fef27f67

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5396396

Reviewed-by: Sylvain Defresne

Commit-Queue: Rohit Rao

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1279614}
